result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon J. Wolf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.05(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:17 a.m. Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement to victim rights legislation; no witnesses will be appearing today - Hogan has no additional witnesses. Schiek statement on sentencing. Hogan statement on sentencing. Defendant statement on sentencing. Court statement on sentencing.
Court sentence
Prison - 30 years - Concurrent 
 Initial confinement - 19 years
 Extended supervision - 11 years
    CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
    DNA Sample
 
Sentence Credit - 336 days

Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program. 

Appeal rights given. Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment given. 
Adj. 10:21 a.m.

8:16 am. Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Covened in 1st floor hearing room - jurors are in 2nd floor hearing room. State files Amended Information amending to 2nd degree intentional homicide, PTAC, - Plea questionnaire filed. Court statement on Alford plea - Court finds sufficient information in record to find Amended Information is acceptable to court and allows Alford plea. Hogan in receipt of information - waive further reading - Defendant enters Guilty by Alford plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Neither party requesting PSI - Court does not require PSI. Bail revoked. Adj. 8:35 a.m. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

2:16 p.m. Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in custody.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State's Motion in Limine - Schiek/Hogan stipulation to preclusion of specific criminal matters - Court accepts stipulation and finds no questions to be put to T.E.  regarding criminal cases. Schiek statement to 3rd party liability evidence/Hogan statement/Court finds there is sufficient basis to allow defense to elicit testimony in regard to third party liability evidence. 
Guidelines regarding third party evidence:
Law enforcement officers may be questioned. Evidence can be presented to establish facts in proffer in Defendant's response filed January 7, 2016. 
Schiek requests leave to add name to witness list if witness can be found. Hogan states no additional witnesses to be named to prove 3rd party liability - witnesses to be questionned are on Defense and State's Witness list.
Schiek/Hogan stipulate to number of convictions of State's/Defendant's witnesses - Court finds if asked if convicted of crime/how many times, they need to answer as follows:
L.W. - yes - 5
M.S. - yes - 20
R.G. - yes - 8
D.G. - no question
S.B. - yes - 5
J.J. - yes - 5
R.B. - yes - 2 
K.W. - yes - 4 
K.W. (male)  - yes - 2
Defendant - yes - 11
Defense motion to discovery - Hogan statement - matter has not been resolved - Schiek states believes matter will be resolved - motion taken under advisement - Hogan requests to address issue prior to trial on Monday. 
Defense motion in limine - (1) prior criminal record of defendant - already resolved; (2) Law enforcement video of 1/22/15 - Schiek/Hogan/Court statement. Recess 2:53 p.m. On record 3:00 p.m.
Court finds that if there is discussion in video concerning acts that have already been deemed admissible - then State may play - if there is discussion concerning acts that have been ruled not admissible - not able to play - if discussion has not been covered by prior rulings - Defense may object and ask for court review of that portion. Hogan reiterates objection to playing 1/22/15 video as entire video is irrelevant. (3) Law enforcement video of 1/21/15 after 45:00 minute mark - Schiek statement / Court statement - Hogan statement that motion is held open (4) Law enforcement video between defendant and Chief Steffes - Hogan statement to removing 2nd portion of interview between minutes 9:00 and 15:00. Schiek statement / Court statement - Court can review video and rule prior to trial on Monday. Schiek/Hogan/Court statement to playing of audio. (5) Schiek statement -will not present evidence concerning defendant's likelihood of commiting. Hogan statement to lack of denial as an indication of guilt - Schiek statement - Court states any evidence concerning lack of denial is prohibited. (6) Prohibition of Officer Chiamulera testimony - motion granted.
Schiek questions how jury will be informed of prior conviction -if JOC's will be allowed - Court finds sentence is not relevant - jury will see defendant in custody. 
Hogan made aware that LW  and MS were booked at same time - Schiek informed Hogan today of fact that they were transported together - Hogan moves to disallow MS to testify due to possible conversation with State's key witness. Schiek statement - Hogan statement to concern to disallow LW's  testimony as well - Court can't assume that anything happened during transport - Court questions Sgt. Gardner regarding transport. Sgt. Gardner called as witness/sworn/Court questions witness/Hogan direct/Schiek cross/Hogan re-direct. Court finds that there is no basis to exclude testimony at this time. If MS is substantially similar to underlying testimony - no need to bring up transport - if testimony deviates from prior - Court directs counsel to bring up objection as side bar or outside of jury's presence. Hogan moves for no contact provision between MS and LW - Court rules no written communication between MS and LW prior to conclusion of testimony. Court statement to security at trial - trial court has discretion to determine restraints in State v. Grinder - Court questions Sgt. Gardner regarding defendant's conduct - Schiek not aware of any disruptive behavior - Court finds that restraints in front of jury are not required - Sgt. Gardner statement to ankle restraint - Hogan objects to use of ankle restraint - Court finds ruling applicable to visible restraints (ankle restraints) as well - any visible restraint not to be used during trial - any new information comes to attention of Court - issue will be revisited.  Hogan/Schiek statement to any other Miranda/Goodchild issues - none exist. Court instructs counsel to contact him over the weekend if other issues arise for resolution prior to trial. Adj. 4:11 p.m.
Slack-w/cert of service
Biesik - w/cert of ser
Barlowski-w/cert of service

Defendants
Defendant's motion to compel discovery or dismiss
in Limine

Pudlowski - w/certificate of service

States Reply to Discovery, State's Demand for Discovery  and State's Reply to Discovery continued  - includes cover letter
of Habeas Corpus Ad Testficandum and Order to Sheriff/Warden
of Habeas Corpus Ad Testficandum and Order to Sheriff/Warden
State's  - includes cover letter
Status conference at 12-28-2015 04:00 pm

10:37 a.m. Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement to Motion for Sanctions and motion re State's expert witness - Discussion was had in Chambers - Schiek states State will not be calling expert witness - Hogan withdraws motion. Court statements regarding timeliness of production of discovery. Court finds State turned over materials immediately upon receipt. Court states issue of whether law enforcement held discovery and issue to whether materials are exculpatory exists. Hogan statement to motion. Schiek statement to motion. Hogan additional statement to motion. Court finds that evidence is not exculpatory per se  and that State has not failed to turn over exculpatory information in a timely manner and denies defendant's motion for sanctions. Court will revisit issue if additional information is brought to Court's attention. Hogan statement to audio/telephonic evidence will be presented - no transcripts are prepared of audio but audio is time-stamped. Schiek statement to audio to be presented - no objection to lack of transcripts. Schiek requests pre-trial conference prior to jury trial. Counsel to contact Judicial Assistant to obtain dates for any hearings. Adj. 11:11 a.m.
for Sanctions
in Opposition to State's Expert and Motion to Compel Summary of Opinions
State's Exhibit 1 - Motion Hearing 12/10/15 - recorded interview from 2/12/15 - not scannable - currently in File 2

1:35 p.m. Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in court, in custody, with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement--reviews motions to be addressed. Schiek statement--motion to suppress statements; State calls Joshua Chiamulera, Rhinelander P.D. detective, sworn, direct. State's Exh. 1 (Disk/recorded interview from 2/12/15) marked. Cross by Hogan/questioned by the Court. State's Exh. 1 offered/received. Hogan statement on suppression motion/Schiek statement. Court statement - references Ct. of Appeals St. v. Ross, 203 Wis.2d 66/Miranda Issue. Court grants defendant's Motion to Suppress--at or about 29 min/45 seconds anything thereafter excluded. Court statement--Admit Other Acts Motion/in receipt of Hogan's response. Court/Hogan statement. Court grants State's Other Acts 4-7 & 9-11, subject to defense ability to cross-examine and present evidence. State's Other Acts 1 --Court/Schiek/Hogan statement. Court references s. 904.03--denies State's Other Acts 1. Court/Schiek/Hogan statement to State's Other Acts 2. Court denies State's Other Acts 2. State's Other Acts 3--Court discloses he was present at time of State's Other Acts 3/State withdraws motion for State's Other Acts 3.  Schiek speaks to credibility arguments as to each exhibit; Court statement--s. 904.03 applicable to all evidence. State's Other Acts 8--Court/Schiek/Hogan statement. Court statement--references s. 904.02/904.04(2); Court grants State's Other Acts 8. Court statement to Defense motion, references s. 940.04(2), 904.06, 906.08. Hogan relies on written motion as argument to s. 904.04(2)/904.06. Court statement--speaks to untruthful conduct/motivation; s. 904.04(2); Court finds items of evidence to cross-examination are not admissable under s. 904.04(2)/denied. Court statement--speaks to habit and routine practice; s. 904.06; Court finds items of evidence to cross examination are not admissable to s. 904.06/denied. 

Court statement--speaks to s. 906.08(2); credibiilty by extrinsic evidence on cross is admissable but items to be addressed individually--14 items of untruthful conduct by LW/s. 904.04(2):  
1) 8/16/2000--Schiek/Hogan/Court statement--denied cross-examination
2) 7/03/2002--Hogan/Schiek/Court statement--granted. Schiek questions parameters--Court statement/speaks to extrinsic evidence; s. 906.08(2); 84 Wis. 2d 145/collateral matter--cross can occur but defense must accept answer/no additional evidence to dispute - no extrinsic evidence can be offered
3) 08/27/2002 - Hogan/Schiek/Court statement--granted cross-examination/extrinsic evidence denied
4) 07/18/2003 - Hogan/Schiek/Court statement--granted cross examination/extrinsic does not apply as already addressed under State's Other Acts motion-denied
5) 08/18/2003 - Hogan/Schiek/Court statement--denied cross-examination
6) 10/03/2003 - Schiek/Court statement--granted cross-examination/extrinsic evidence denied
7) Father accusations - Court statement/Hogan statement--references Other Acts 6 above. Court statement--denied cross-examination
8) 07/27/2010 - Schiek/Court statement--granted cross-examination
9) 12/12/2011 - Court statmenet - granted cross-examination/extrinsic does not apply as already addressed under State's Other Acts motion--denied
10) 07/15/2012 - Court statement--granted cross-examination
11) 06/08/2013 - Court statement--denied cross-examination
12) 09/01/2013 - Court statement--granted cross-examination/extrinsic evidence denied
13) 12/28/2013 - Court statement--granted cross-examination/extrinsic evidence denied
14) MF/LW 2013 - Court statement-Hogan/Court statement--granted cross-examination/extrinsic evidence denied
Court references s. 906.08(1). Schiek statement. Hogan statement--notes possible additional motions to be filed. Next hearing scheduled for 12/17/15 at 10:15 a.m. Hogan statement--requests Court quash Writ for purposes of making defendant available for future hearings and trial. Court quashes Writ. 4:06 p.m. adj.
State's Reply to Discovery continued
Ad Testificandum and Order to Sheriff/Warden
Defendant's Response:  State's Motion to Admit Other Acts Evidence
Brown County called and stated that defendant wasn't the one who refused to go with Transport Officers - their mistake - different County's defendant refused to go - again NOT this defendant.

to admit other evidence pursuant to 904.04(2a) & 904.04(2b) Wis. Stats.

Jury trial was not scheduled on the record - was done in chambers as the 2016 calendar was in chambers.  Jury is scheduled from January 11, 2106 thru Friday, January 22, 2016.
Exhibit 1 (13 pages of Inmate Request Forms)

9:05 a.m. Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Defendant does not appear--Hogan waives his appearance, no objection by the State. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement. Hogan statement--open records request/in receipt of those documents; jail telephone calls - Hogan worked with Schiek/IT and now has received a disc with information requested. Hogan states still requesting notes, audio requests.  State's Exh. 1 (13 pages of Inmate Rquests) marked, offered, received. State calls Joshua Chiamulera, Detective with RPD, sworn, direct. Cross by Hogan; questioned by the Court. Hogan statement as to interview mtgs.--requests Court order any recordings conducted after 1/28/15 with Latoya Wolf while in custody. Schiek statement--will inquire of the Sheriff's Dept. Court finds that Det. Chiamulera did not generate any written reports/documents reletive to requests in Exh. 1; finds no such reports, notes exist relative to Chiamulera. Court does not believe sheriff's dept. is intentionlly withholding any information. Court to sign order.
to Compel Discovery or Dismiss

3:04 p.m. Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  MIchael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Shannon J. Wolf not in court.  Defendant is an inmate in prison - appearance at today's hearing is excused by Court. Counsel acknowledges receipt of Social Services documents from Court. Court will authorize use of any confidential records at trial prior to admission. Contents not be disclosed to anyone besides DA staff or integral to investigation and that those individuals not disclose information to anyone else - Contents not be disclosed to anyone beside PD, client, Pd staff or anyone working for PD's office with same caution not to disclose information. Prosecution/defense ready to proceed on trial dates. Schiek states will need motion hearing date prior to trial. Any properly noticed motions will be heard on pre-trial date. Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm. Adj. 3:14 p.m.

11:44 a.m. Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court. Defendant does not appear/non-evidentiary matter--Mr. Wolf's appearance is excused. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement as to incamera review of records of Mr. Steinmetz - mental disorder/references Case Nos. 14ME108/14ME101/11ME147/02ME79 -- except for 14ME101, all other cases dismissed prior to probable cause hearing - Court references 78 Wis. 2nd 346/Court finds nothing in records giving rise to basis to have records disclosed; defense not entitled to examination of records. Court has reviewed volumonouse records relative to TPR proceedings--finds portion of record 225 page document--chronological record/dispositional questionnaires -- Court finds some of this information relevant and should be provided to the parties/counsel can argue admissibility at a later date. Court will confirm which documents subject to discloser and will provide copies. Hogan statement/provides basis for request for adjournment of jury. State does not object to adjournment. Court statement to adjournment--no speedy trial demand/for reasons stated, adjournment granted by the Court. Bond continued.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
State's Reply to Discovery continued
Additional Discovery
for Release of Social Services File# 09TP01.
Files  concerning Michael Steinmetz, specifically 14ME101, 98ME91 and 97ME97, be release to the Court for in camera inspection.

03:35 pm - Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived appearance at previous hearing.  Motions - In camera inspection relative to a 2009 TRP and in camera inspection relative to the potential disclosure in a Chapter 51 proceeding.  Relative to the second motion concerning Mr. Steinmetz, on the record yesterday with Steinmetz with Atty Jarmuz - do not object to in camera inspection of records.  Court grants in camera inspection of the records.  Schiek/Hogan statement to motion for records of the 2009 Termination or Parental Rights proceeding.  Court grants motions.  Court requests records be provided by July 6th.  Hogan to draft order for Social Services.  No further disclosure is permitted at this time.  Bail continued.  Adjourned 03:57 pm  Jury trial scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Oral Ruling held May 15, 2015

09:05 am - Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Oral Ruling on Motion to Change Venue.  Hogan/Schiek statement to motion.  Court will not deny nor grant defense motion at this time.  Court is taking the motion under advisement pending jury selection process.  Hogan statement to need of defendant to be present at next scheduled non-evidentiary motion hearing.  Court finds the defendant need not be present at non-evidentiary  hearings.  Defendant voluntary waives right to attend non-evideniary hearing under 971.04(1).  Bail continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
to Compel Medical Records and Contents of CH 51.15 Emergency Detention
to compel medical records and contents of county TPR proceeding

10:51 am - Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prior to today, Hogan filed a motion to withdraw as counsel which was granted based upon the information provided on the Affidavit.  However, off the record, Hogan and Schiek provided the court information that the withdrawal from Hogan may need not go through.  Hogan states would like to use this hearing to waive a confidentiality conflict concerning a potential material witness, Michael Steinmetz.  Steinmetz had previsouly been represented by a PD in the Rhinelander Office.  Steinmetz is currently represented by Andrew Jarmuz.  Court finds defendant understands conflict of interest and freely and voluntarily waives the conflict of interest and would like to keep Hogan on the case.  Schiek statement  - does not object to waiver of conflict of interest. Court finds Wolf has given informed consent.  Hogan requests appearing on Wolf's behalf for the Oral Ruling scheduled May 15th.  Court grants request.  Wolf need not appear on May 15th.   11:12 am - Off Record.  11:26 am - Back on record.  In court Michael Steinmetz, in custody with attorney Adrew Jarmuz.  Michael Schiek appears on behalf of the State.  Attorney Maggie Hogan in courtroom.  Defendant Shannon J. Wolf is no longer present.  Court finds Steinmetz understands conflict of interest and freely and voluntarily waives the conflict of interest.  Court finds Stienmetz has given informed consent as it pertains to Hogan's continued representation of Wolf.  Court finds previous motion to withdraw is vacated.  Bail continued.  Adjourned 11:33 a.m.
Court orders clerk to vacate the withdrawal of Hogan as counsel.
with Affidavit

10:22 am - Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hogan states did not receive State's response to motion until 9 a.m. - has not had a chance to review or research the response.  Requests and opportunity to supply a written response to the Court concerning the State's response and then set for an oral ruling.  Hogan submits to Court Exhibit 1 (CD of news broadcasts)-Marked and Rec'd.  The first broadcast will be played and considered, it was played four additional times.  Hogan/Schiek statement to motion.  Court statement to motion.  Will adjourn for oral ruling on motion.  Bail continued.  Oral ruling scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in court via video with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in custody.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
4:03
Hogan filed request to preserve evidence  - mainly correspondance/recorded conversations between co defendant's and being held by Stanley Correctional facility remain and be held pending further order of court along with any letters currently in his cell there. 
Schiek statement in response to request- Court questions Ms Hogan- Hogan statement - Court grants request and phone numbers to be provided - Court will sign order(Hogan to draft new order with additional information)

01:58 pm - Defendant Shannon J. Wolf in court, via video, in custody, with attorney Maggie Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived.  Court indicates represented defendant many years previously in the Public Defenders Office.  Also Defendant did have charges brought against him when Judge Bloom was the DA.  Does not believe a conflict exists.  Schiek/Hogan to bond.  Court sets cash bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
